verses.kjv: The word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD in the tenth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, which was the eighteenth year of Nebuchadrezzar.
verses.web: The word that came to Jeremiah from LORD in the tenth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, which was the eighteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar.
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Jeremiah during the 10th year of King Zedekiah of Judah's reign, which was the 18th year of Nebuchadrezzar.

verses.kjv: For then the king of Babylon’s army besieged Jerusalem: and Jeremiah the prophet was shut up in the court of the prison, which was in the king of Judah’s house.
verses.web: Now at that time the king of Babylon’s army was besieging Jerusalem. Jeremiah the prophet was shut up in the court of the guard, which was in the king of Judah’s house.
verses.ct: At that time, the Babylonian army had Jerusalem under siege, and Jeremiah the prophet was locked up in the courtyard of the guard station inside the king of Judah's palace.

verses.kjv: For Zedekiah king of Judah had shut him up, saying, Wherefore dost thou prophesy, and say, Thus saith the LORD, Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall take it;
verses.web: For Zedekiah king of Judah had shut him up, saying, “Why do you prophesy, and say, ‘LORD says, “Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he will take it;
verses.ct: King Zedekiah of Judah had imprisoned him, demanding, "Why do you keep prophesying? You say, 'The LORD declares: I am going to hand this city over to the king of Babylon, and he will capture it.

verses.kjv: And Zedekiah king of Judah shall not escape out of the hand of the Chaldeans, but shall surely be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon, and shall speak with him mouth to mouth, and his eyes shall behold his eyes;
verses.web: and Zedekiah king of Judah won’t escape out of the hand of the Chaldeans, but will surely be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon, and will speak with him mouth to mouth, and his eyes will see his eyes;
verses.ct: King Zedekiah of Judah won't escape the Chaldeans. He will be handed over to the king of Babylon and will speak with him face to face, looking him straight in the eyes.

verses.kjv: And he shall lead Zedekiah to Babylon, and there shall he be until I visit him, saith the LORD: though ye fight with the Chaldeans, ye shall not prosper.
verses.web: and he will bring Zedekiah to Babylon, and he will be there until I visit him,” says LORD: “though you fight with the Chaldeans, you will not prosper?” ’ ”
verses.ct: He will take Zedekiah to Babylon, where he will remain until I deal with him, says the LORD. Even if you fight the Chaldeans, you will not win.'"

verses.kjv: And Jeremiah said, The word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
verses.web: Jeremiah said, “LORD’s word came to me, saying,
verses.ct: Jeremiah said, "The LORD's word came to me:

verses.kjv: Behold, Hanameel the son of Shallum thine uncle shall come unto thee, saying, Buy thee my field that is in Anathoth: for the right of redemption is thine to buy it.
verses.web: ‘Behold, Hanamel the son of Shallum your uncle will come to you, saying, “Buy my field that is in Anathoth; for the right of redemption is yours to buy it.” ’ ”
verses.ct: 'Your cousin Hanameel, the son of your uncle Shallum, is going to come to you and say, "Buy my field in Anathoth, because as the closest relative, you have the right to buy it."'

verses.kjv: So Hanameel mine uncle’s son came to me in the court of the prison according to the word of the LORD, and said unto me, Buy my field, I pray thee, that is in Anathoth, which is in the country of Benjamin: for the right of inheritance is thine, and the redemption is thine; buy it for thyself. Then I knew that this was the word of the LORD.
verses.web: “So Hanamel my uncle’s son came to me in the court of the guard according to LORD’s word, and said to me, ‘Please buy my field that is in Anathoth, which is in the land of Benjamin; for the right of inheritance is yours, and the redemption is yours. Buy it for yourself.’ “Then I knew that this was LORD’s word.
verses.ct: Just as the LORD had said, my cousin Hanameel came to me in the courtyard of the guard and said, 'Please buy my field in Anathoth, in the territory of Benjamin. You have the right of inheritance and the right to redeem it — buy it for yourself.' That's when I knew for certain this was the LORD's word.

verses.kjv: And I bought the field of Hanameel my uncle’s son, that was in Anathoth, and weighed him the money, even seventeen shekels of silver.
verses.web: I bought the field that was in Anathoth of Hanamel my uncle’s son, and weighed him the money, even seventeen shekels of silver.
verses.ct: So I bought the field in Anathoth from my cousin Hanameel and weighed out the payment — 17 shekels of silver.

verses.kjv: And I subscribed the evidence, and sealed it, and took witnesses, and weighed him the money in the balances.
verses.web: I signed the deed, sealed it, called witnesses, and weighed the money in the balances to him.
verses.ct: I signed the deed, sealed it, brought in witnesses, and weighed out the silver on the scales.

verses.kjv: So I took the evidence of the purchase, both that which was sealed according to the law and custom, and that which was open:
verses.web: So I took the deed of the purchase, both that which was sealed, containing the terms and conditions, and that which was open;
verses.ct: Then I took the deed of purchase — both the sealed copy containing the terms and conditions, and the open copy —

verses.kjv: And I gave the evidence of the purchase unto Baruch the son of Neriah, the son of Maaseiah, in the sight of Hanameel mine uncle’s son, and in the presence of the witnesses that subscribed the book of the purchase, before all the Jews that sat in the court of the prison.
verses.web: and I delivered the deed of the purchase to Baruch the son of Neriah, the son of Mahseiah, in the presence of Hanamel my uncle’s son, and in the presence of the witnesses who signed the deed of the purchase, before all the Jews who sat in the court of the guard.
verses.ct: and I handed them to Baruch son of Neriah, son of Maaseiah. I did this in front of my cousin Hanameel, in front of the witnesses who had signed the deed, and in front of all the people of Judah who were sitting in the courtyard of the guard.

verses.kjv: And I charged Baruch before them, saying,
verses.web: “I commanded Baruch before them, saying,
verses.ct: Then, in front of everyone, I gave Baruch these instructions:

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel; Take these evidences, this evidence of the purchase, both which is sealed, and this evidence which is open; and put them in an earthen vessel, that they may continue many days.
verses.web: LORD of Armies, the God of Israel says: ‘Take these deeds, this deed of the purchase which is sealed, and this deed which is open, and put them in an earthen vessel, that they may last many days.’
verses.ct: "The LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, says: Take these deeds — both the sealed copy and the open copy — and store them in a clay jar so they will be preserved for a long time.

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel; Houses and fields and vineyards shall be possessed again in this land.
verses.web: For LORD of Armies, the God of Israel says: ‘Houses and fields and vineyards will yet again be bought in this land.’
verses.ct: Because the LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, declares: The day is coming when houses, fields, and vineyards will be bought and sold in this land again."

verses.kjv: Now when I had delivered the evidence of the purchase unto Baruch the son of Neriah, I prayed unto the LORD, saying,
verses.web: Now after I had delivered the deed of the purchase to Baruch the son of Neriah, I prayed to LORD, saying,
verses.ct: After I had given the deed of purchase to Baruch son of Neriah, I prayed to the LORD:

verses.kjv: Ah Lord GOD! behold, thou hast made the heaven and the earth by thy great power and stretched out arm, and there is nothing too hard for thee:
verses.web: “Ah Lord LORD! Behold, you have made the heavens and the earth by your great power and by your outstretched arm. There is nothing too hard for you.
verses.ct: "Lord GOD! You made the heavens and the earth by your great power and your outstretched arm. Nothing is too hard for you.

verses.kjv: Thou shewest lovingkindness unto thousands, and recompensest the iniquity of the fathers into the bosom of their children after them: the Great, the Mighty God, the LORD of hosts, is his name,
verses.web: You show loving kindness to thousands, and repay the iniquity of the fathers into the bosom of their children after them. The great, the mighty God, LORD of Armies is your name:
verses.ct: You show mercy to thousands, yet you also bring the consequences of the parents' sin upon their children after them. You are the great and mighty God — the LORD of Armies is your name.

verses.kjv: Great in counsel, and mighty in work: for thine eyes are open upon all the ways of the sons of men: to give every one according to his ways, and according to the fruit of his doings:
verses.web: great in counsel, and mighty in work; whose eyes are open to all the ways of the children of men, to give everyone according to his ways, and according to the fruit of his doings;
verses.ct: Your plans are vast and your actions are powerful. Your eyes see everything people do, and you repay each person according to their ways and the results of their actions.

verses.kjv: Which hast set signs and wonders in the land of Egypt, even unto this day, and in Israel, and among other men; and hast made thee a name, as at this day;
verses.web: who performed signs and wonders in the land of Egypt, even to this day, both in Israel and among other men; and made yourself a name, as it is today;
verses.ct: You performed signs and wonders in Egypt — and you continue to do so to this day, both in Israel and among all nations. You made a name for yourself that endures to this day.

verses.kjv: And hast brought forth thy people Israel out of the land of Egypt with signs, and with wonders, and with a strong hand, and with a stretched out arm, and with great terror;
verses.web: and brought your people Israel out of the land of Egypt with signs, with wonders, with a strong hand, with an outstretched arm, and with great terror;
verses.ct: You brought your people Israel out of Egypt with signs and wonders, with a strong hand and an outstretched arm, and with overwhelming power.

verses.kjv: And hast given them this land, which thou didst swear to their fathers to give them, a land flowing with milk and honey;
verses.web: and gave them this land, which you swore to their fathers to give them, a land flowing with milk and honey.
verses.ct: You gave them this land that you had sworn to their ancestors — a land flowing with milk and honey.

verses.kjv: And they came in, and possessed it; but they obeyed not thy voice, neither walked in thy law; they have done nothing of all that thou commandedst them to do: therefore thou hast caused all this evil to come upon them:
verses.web: They came in and possessed it, but they didn’t obey your voice and didn’t walk in your law. They have done nothing of all that you commanded them to do. Therefore you have caused all this evil to come upon them.
verses.ct: They came in and took possession of it, but they didn't obey you or follow your law. They failed to do anything you commanded them. That is why you brought all this disaster on them.

verses.kjv: Behold the mounts, they are come unto the city to take it; and the city is given into the hand of the Chaldeans, that fight against it, because of the sword, and of the famine, and of the pestilence: and what thou hast spoken is come to pass; and, behold, thou seest it.
verses.web: “Behold, siege ramps have come to the city to take it. The city is given into the hand of the Chaldeans who fight against it, because of the sword, of the famine, and of the pestilence. What you have spoken has happened. Behold, you see it.
verses.ct: Look — the siege ramps are already built up against the city walls to capture it. Because of war, famine, and disease, the city is being handed over to the Chaldeans who are attacking it. Everything you said would happen has come true — you can see it with your own eyes.

verses.kjv: And thou hast said unto me, O Lord GOD, Buy thee the field for money, and take witnesses; for the city is given into the hand of the Chaldeans.
verses.web: You have said to me, Lord LORD, ‘Buy the field for money, and call witnesses;’ whereas the city is given into the hand of the Chaldeans.”
verses.ct: And yet, Lord GOD, you told me, 'Buy the field with silver and bring witnesses' — even though the city is being handed over to the Chaldeans!"

verses.kjv: Then came the word of the LORD unto Jeremiah, saying,
verses.web: Then LORD’s word came to Jeremiah, saying,
verses.ct: Then the LORD's word came to Jeremiah:

verses.kjv: Behold, I am the LORD, the God of all flesh: is there any thing too hard for me?
verses.web: “Behold, I am LORD, the God of all flesh. Is there anything too hard for me?
verses.ct: "I am the LORD, the God of all living things. Is anything too hard for me?

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD; Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the Chaldeans, and into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, and he shall take it:
verses.web: Therefore LORD says: Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the Chaldeans, and into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and he will take it.
verses.ct: Therefore, the LORD says: I am going to hand this city over to the Chaldeans and to King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon, and he will capture it.

verses.kjv: And the Chaldeans, that fight against this city, shall come and set fire on this city, and burn it with the houses, upon whose roofs they have offered incense unto Baal, and poured out drink offerings unto other gods, to provoke me to anger.
verses.web: The Chaldeans, who fight against this city, will come and set this city on fire, and burn it with the houses on whose roofs they have offered incense to Baal, and poured out drink offerings to other gods, to provoke me to anger.
verses.ct: The Chaldeans attacking this city will break through, set it on fire, and burn it down — including the houses where people burned incense to Baal on the rooftops and poured out drink offerings to other gods, provoking my anger.

verses.kjv: For the children of Israel and the children of Judah have only done evil before me from their youth: for the children of Israel have only provoked me to anger with the work of their hands, saith the LORD.
verses.web: “For the children of Israel and the children of Judah have done only that which was evil in my sight from their youth; for the children of Israel have only provoked me to anger with the work of their hands, says LORD.
verses.ct: The people of Israel and Judah have done nothing but evil before me from their youth. The people of Israel have done nothing but provoke my anger with the things their hands have made, says the LORD.

verses.kjv: For this city hath been to me as a provocation of mine anger and of my fury from the day that they built it even unto this day; that I should remove it from before my face,
verses.web: For this city has been to me a provocation of my anger and of my wrath from the day that they built it even to this day, so that I should remove it from before my face,
verses.ct: From the day this city was built until now, it has been nothing but a source of my anger and fury. That is why I must remove it from my sight.

verses.kjv: Because of all the evil of the children of Israel and of the children of Judah, which they have done to provoke me to anger, they, their kings, their princes, their priests, and their prophets, and the men of Judah, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
verses.web: because of all the evil of the children of Israel and of the children of Judah, which they have done to provoke me to anger: they, their kings, their princes, their priests, their prophets, the men of Judah, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
verses.ct: All the evil that the people of Israel and Judah have done to provoke my anger — their kings, their officials, their priests, their prophets, the people of Judah, and the residents of Jerusalem —

verses.kjv: And they have turned unto me the back, and not the face: though I taught them, rising up early and teaching them, yet they have not hearkened to receive instruction.
verses.web: They have turned their backs to me, and not their faces. Although I taught them, rising up early and teaching them, yet they have not listened to receive instruction.
verses.ct: they turned their backs on me instead of their faces. Even though I taught them again and again, they refused to listen or accept correction.

verses.kjv: But they set their abominations in the house, which is called by my name, to defile it.
verses.web: But they set their abominations in the house which is called by my name, to defile it.
verses.ct: They placed their disgusting idols in the house that bears my name, making it unclean.

verses.kjv: And they built the high places of Baal, which are in the valley of the son of Hinnom, to cause their sons and their daughters to pass through the fire unto Molech; which I commanded them not, neither came it into my mind, that they should do this abomination, to cause Judah to sin.
verses.web: They built the high places of Baal, which are in the valley of the son of Hinnom, to cause their sons and their daughters to pass through fire to Molech, which I didn’t command them. It didn’t even come into my mind, that they should do this abomination, to cause Judah to sin.”
verses.ct: They built worship sites for Baal in the Valley of Ben Hinnom, where they sacrificed their sons and daughters in the fire to Molech. I never commanded this. It never even entered my mind that they would commit such a horrific thing, leading Judah into sin."

verses.kjv: And now therefore thus saith the LORD, the God of Israel, concerning this city, whereof ye say, It shall be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon by the sword, and by the famine, and by the pestilence;
verses.web: Now therefore LORD, the God of Israel, says concerning this city, about which you say, “It is given into the hand of the king of Babylon by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence:”
verses.ct: "Now then, here is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says about this city — the one you say is being handed over to the king of Babylon through war, famine, and disease:

verses.kjv: Behold, I will gather them out of all countries, whither I have driven them in mine anger, and in my fury, and in great wrath; and I will bring them again unto this place, and I will cause them to dwell safely:
verses.web: “Behold, I will gather them out of all the countries where I have driven them in my anger, and in my wrath, and in great indignation; and I will bring them again to this place. I will cause them to dwell safely.
verses.ct: I will gather my people from every country where I scattered them in my anger, fury, and fierce rage. I will bring them back to this place and let them live here in safety.

verses.kjv: And they shall be my people, and I will be their God:
verses.web: Then they will be my people, and I will be their God.
verses.ct: They will be my people, and I will be their God.

verses.kjv: And I will give them one heart, and one way, that they may fear me for ever, for the good of them, and of their children after them:
verses.web: I will give them one heart and one way, that they may fear me forever, for their good, and the good of their children after them.
verses.ct: I will give them a united heart and a single purpose — to fear me always — for their own good and for the good of their children after them.

verses.kjv: And I will make an everlasting covenant with them, that I will not turn away from them, to do them good; but I will put my fear in their hearts, that they shall not depart from me.
verses.web: I will make an everlasting covenant with them, that I will not turn away from following them, to do them good. I will put my fear in their hearts, that they may not depart from me.
verses.ct: I will make an everlasting covenant with them: I will never stop doing good for them. And I will put the fear of me in their hearts so they will never turn away from me.

verses.kjv: Yea, I will rejoice over them to do them good, and I will plant them in this land assuredly with my whole heart and with my whole soul.
verses.web: Yes, I will rejoice over them to do them good, and I will plant them in this land assuredly with my whole heart and with my whole soul.”
verses.ct: I will take delight in doing good for them, and I will firmly plant them in this land with all my heart and all my soul."

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD; Like as I have brought all this great evil upon this people, so will I bring upon them all the good that I have promised them.
verses.web: For LORD says: “Just as I have brought all this great evil on this people, so I will bring on them all the good that I have promised them.
verses.ct: The LORD says: "Just as I brought all this terrible disaster on these people, I will also bring them every good thing I have promised.

verses.kjv: And fields shall be bought in this land, whereof ye say, It is desolate without man or beast; it is given into the hand of the Chaldeans.
verses.web: Fields will be bought in this land, about which you say, ‘It is desolate, without man or animal. It is given into the hand of the Chaldeans.’
verses.ct: Fields will be bought again in this land — the very land you now say is a wasteland, empty of people and animals, handed over to the Chaldeans.

verses.kjv: Men shall buy fields for money, and subscribe evidences, and seal them, and take witnesses in the land of Benjamin, and in the places about Jerusalem, and in the cities of Judah, and in the cities of the mountains, and in the cities of the valley, and in the cities of the south: for I will cause their captivity to return, saith the LORD.
verses.web: Men will buy fields for money, sign the deeds, seal them, and call witnesses, in the land of Benjamin, and in the places around Jerusalem, in the cities of Judah, in the cities of the hill country, in the cities of the lowland, and in the cities of the South; for I will cause their captivity to be reversed,” says LORD.
verses.ct: People will buy fields with silver, sign deeds, seal them, and call witnesses — in the territory of Benjamin, in the areas around Jerusalem, in the cities of Judah, in the hill country, in the lowlands, and in the southern region. I will restore their fortunes," says the LORD.
